page.title: 15RELIGION
page.content: Francis Crittall did not neglect man's religious needs.A site and barn was offered to the C of E and this was converted and dedicated to St.Francis in 1930.It is a daughter church to the parish church of St.Mary's Rivenhall. (where the rector lives).There is one service (congregation 20-30 approx.) and Sunday School.It has no room for social events.The Congregational Church also built in 1930 has a lay minister and Congregation of 20 approx.There is a hall for Sunday School,a Friday Club for children,and various adult groups.It is also a village social centre with a daily Good Neighbours scheme.The R.C.Church built in 1966,shares a priest with Witham.A congregation (approx.100) of mainly young mums,children and older people has one Mass on Sundays.
